intro: Erodium laciniatum f. soluntinum, commonly known as the Soluntine bedstraw, is a flowering plant belonging to the Geraniaceae family. It is a low-growing perennial with finely divided, fern-like leaves that give it a delicate appearance. The plant produces small, pinkish to reddish flowers that bloom in clusters during the spring and summer months. It is native to the Mediterranean region and thrives in sunny, well-drained soils. This variety is often found in rocky or gravelly habitats, showcasing its adaptability to harsh environmental conditions.
